summary: Our Film Project â€“ Creative Video Presentations Welcome to our page, where we showcase a collection of our film projects, each reflecting our passion for visual storytelling and cinematic craft. Every video is carefully filmed and edited in DaVinci Resolve, highlighting our creative ideas and technical skills. From stunning landscapes to unique moments and experimental shots, these videos capture our enthusiasm for filmmaking and invite you to see the world from our perspective.
title: Filming Projects

summary: Flight to Windhoek (07.06) In the morning, the accommodation staff member drove us to the small airport in Katima Mililo. The airport was an old smal building, and there were no planes present. Rozilia, Katie and me went through the necessary security checks and waited in the small waiting room. Unfortunately, the flight was delayed, so we spent quite a bit of time waiting. Eventually, we boarded a small airplane, similar in size to the one I took from Johannesburg to Victoria Falls town where one seat was on one side and two on the other side.
title: Namibia

summary: Leaving South Africa (02.06) We woke up early and headed to the airport to catch a flight from Johannesburg to Victoria Falls Town. It was the smallest plane I had ever flown on for a city transfer. The airplane had just three seats in one row, with one seat on the left and two on the right side. We landed in Victoria Falls Town, Zimbabwe. Juan accompanied me to the border with Zambia since I had booked a bed in a hostel in Livingstone.
title: Victoria Falls

summary: Exploring the Wildlife in Kruger (30.05) Our journey began with Juan’s booking of an early morning driving tour with a knowledgeable guide for a mere $20. The irresistible deal prompted us to join him on this adventure. Riding in a classic safari jeep with seats in the back, we embarked on an exhilarating tour through Kruger National Park. The diverse wildlife we encountered left us in awe - graceful giraffes, majestic elephants, colorful birds, graceful antelopes, playful zebras, and even a few curious chickens.
title: Kruger

summary: Exploring Johannesburg: A Memorable Adventure Stepping foot in Johannesburg after a grueling 20-hour journey, I knew I was in for an exciting and challenging experience. My first task was to secure a reliable internet connection at the airport, enabling me to book an Uber or Bolt ride to my hostel. Although it took more than an hour to get the Wi-Fi working, I finally succeeded. Little did I know that another hurdle awaited me just outside the secure area where families and friends typically gather.
title: Johannesburg

summary:
The first little post Welcome, dear reader! It’s great to have you here on my brand new webpage.
If you’re interested in learning more about me, please feel free to check out the About Me section.
I’m still new to building websites, so there maybe some issues here and there. This website was built using Hugo, which is a static webpage tool that heavily utilizes markdown.
That’s all for now, but if you need to contact me, the best way to reach me is through email.
title: First post

summary:
About Wow, a whole page about me ;D
Why this website? Hey there, this is a small project that was created at the beginning of 2023 to not only implement initially implemented software projects half-finished, but also to learn to put a finished website live. Yeah, crap, then you have to fill it with content! That’s how I documented my little tour through the south of Africa. I put a lot into it, but it wasn’t really for me to document my trip.
